Detailed Description

A GenericAlleleSet represents a concrete allele set implementation. It is usefull to instantiate a new AlleleSet when the allele values are contained by a list, by an array or by a Set. At creation time, the aplhabet objects are not cloned so:

Note that this implementation is not synchronized. If multiple threads access a GenericAlleleSet concurrently, and at least one of the threads modifies the set, it must be synchronized externally or wrapped using the Collections#synchronizedSet(Set) method.

Note that if values are modified externally, the allele set object also change according at that modification.

Some examples of code are provided below.

<blockquote>

    Set s = Collections.synchronizedSet(new HashSet(...));
    GenericAlleleSet geneticAlleleSet = new GenericAlleleSet(s);
</blockquote> to build a generic allele set with the object value accesses synchronized.

<blockquote>

    GenericAlleleSet generic alleleSet = new GenericAlleleSet<Boolean>(true, false),
</blockquote> to build a generic allele set with the boolean values as allele object values.

<blockquote>

    GenericAlleleSet generic alleleSet = new GenericAlleleSet(AnyJavaEnum.values()) );
</blockquote> to build a generic allele set with the enum values.

void jenes.chromosome.GenericAlleleSet< T >.setDifferences ( double  diff[][]  ) 

Sets the difference matrix between alleles. It is expected that diff is a square matrix according to set size, with diff(i,i) = 0 and diff(i,j) = -diff(j,i).

Parameters:
diff - the difference matrix

double [][] jenes.chromosome.GenericAlleleSet< T >.getDefaultDifferences (  ) 

Returns the default difference matrix as given by the difference of allele positions in the set.

Returns:
the allele difference matrix.
